availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Thornbrough (Mayfield, Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Mayfield, Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of H. Thornbrough and Martha Thornbrough. Farmer in Graves County in 1860. Mustered in as sergeant in the 20th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) on September 1, 1862, in Louisville. Promoted from sergeant to 2nd lieutenant on January 1, 1863. Promoted to 1st lieutenant on September 1, 1863. Died at Louisville, on February 10, 1864, of small pox.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 64, 952.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves, Mayfield, p. 325.
